flawed_nl_solution:
The girls make up one-third of the campers, so there are 96 /3 = <<96/3=32>>32 girls.
The boys make up two-thirds of the campers, so there are 32 + 32 = <<32+32=64>>64 boys.
There are 32 x 75% = <<32*75*0.01=24>>24 girls who want to toast marshmallows.
There are 64 x 50% = <<64*50*0.01=23>>23 boys who want to toast marshmallows.
They need 24 + 23 = <<24+23=47>>47 marshmallows.
#### 47

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 23. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
